title: Understanding Intellectual Functioning
text: Intellectual functioning refers to the cognitive abilities of an individual. It involves how a person learns, reasons, and solves problems.

title: Components of Intellectual Functioning
text: Consider the different aspects of intellectual functioning, such as learning, problem-solving, and reasoning. These are key components that define intellectual functioning.

hintAnswer: the way a person learns and $$problem-solves$$
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes intellectual functioning?
choices: the way a person learns and $$problem-solves$$
a person’s ability to conduct their activities of daily living through communication and independent living
intellectual functioning that falls below an IQ of $$70$$ and starts before age eighteen
a person’s abilities in language, reading, writing, math, reasoning, knowledge, and memory
